title: Pens needed to write a sentence

data.title: Pens needed to write a sentence
data.statement:
You're given [[a]] pens, each pen can write up to [[b]] characters. Based on given sentence [[s]] you must calculate minimum pens to write a sentence.

Spaces and characters: {{.}} {{,}} {{'}} {{"}} {{;}} don't count into characters that use up the pen.

testCases.title: Simple sentence
testCases.testIn:
1
30
This one seems to be a simple test

testCases.title: Simple sentence vaildator
testCases.testIn:
1
15
This one seems to be a simple test

testCases.title: Not much of a sentence validator
Short sentence
testCases.testIn:
2
53
I, that love's majesty To the oceans buried. Nor monuments; I, that love's majesty To frightful adversaries, He capers nimbly in a lute.

testCases.title: Short sentence validator
testCases.testIn:
2
25
I, that love's majesty To the oceans buried. Nor monuments; I, that love's majesty To frightful adversaries, He capers nimbly in a lute.

testCases.title: Long sentence
Long sentence validator

data.stubGenerator:
read a:int 
read b:int
read s:string(2000)

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[a]] pens given
<<Line 2:>> [[b]] maximum characters written by pen
<<Line 3:>> [[s]] sentence needed to be written with pens
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> <<Minimum number of pens>> needed to write a text followed by <<Enough>> if there is enough pens or <<Not enough>> if there is not enough pens to write whole sentence.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You're given a pens, each pen can write up to b characters. Based on given sentence s you must calculate minimum pens to write a sentence.

Spaces and characters: . , ' " ; don't count into characters that use up the pen.
Input
Line 1: a pens given
Line 2: b maximum characters written by pen
Line 3: s sentence needed to be written with pens
Output
Line 1: Minimum number of pens needed to write a text followed by Enough if there is enough pens or Not enough if there is not enough pens to write whole sentence.
Constraints
Example
Input
1
30
This one seems to be a simple test
Output
1 Enough
